title: Which sites provide online courses and certification?  - Quora

response.answer_text: All about digital leaning platforms Digital learning platforms have blossomed during the recent pandemic times and it has changed the way we look towards our education system. Believe me guys, the system of education in recent decade is changing drastically with the introduction of digital teaching platforms out of which majority of them are standalone platforms helping students not only in their primary education but also to crack competitive exams recently. Dependence on these platforms for certifications and digital qualifications have increased and they have got the much needed validation from major corporates and schools in the recent years. Let us look at some of the widely used digital education platforms globally Socrative Designed by a group of entrepreneurs and engineers passionate about education, Socrative is a system that allows teachers to create exercises or educational games which students can solve using mobile devices- whether smartphones, laptops, or tablets. Thinglink Thinglink allows educators to create interactive images with music, sounds, texts, and photographs. These can also be shared on other websites or on social networks, such as Twitter and Facebook. Thinglink offers the possibility for teachers to create learning methodologies that awaken the curiosity of students through interactive content that can expand their knowledge. TED-Ed TED-Ed is an educational platform that allows creating educational lessons with the collaboration of teachers, students, animators—generally people who want to expand knowledge and good ideas. This website allows democratizing access to information, both for teachers and students. Here, people can have an active participation in the learning process of others. Edmodo Edmodo is an educational tool that connects teachers and students, and is assimilated into a social network. In this , teachers can create online collaborative groups, administer and provide educational materials, measure student performance, and communicate with parents, among other functions Vidyakul learning This app is based on the mission to bridge the gap between tutors and students. This app helps students in meeting renowned teachers online. Vidyakul works to provide students, parents and teachers with a perfect online platform to solve all their problems related to learning and teaching online. Khan Academy This app is founded by an American Educator Salman Khan. This is a complete non-profit app and its sole purpose is to provide better learning tools to students. This app has more than 10,000 video lectures on different academic subjects majorly focused on Mathematics and science. They have partnered with institutions like NASA, MIT, the modern museum of art for specialized content to empower the learners outside the classrooms as well. BYJU’s It is one of the well-funded and well-managed start-up which has the motto to make learning fun for students. This app is already considered as one of the best education apps in India. It has very engaging video lessons which help in adaptive learning. This app also has mock tests and sample papers for class 7-12 for all the board exams which help in preparing for competitive exams like IIT-JEE, CAT and NEET. It’s detailed performance analysis feature helps students to improve their performance.

There are plenty of websites like edX, Udemy, Udacity, Coursera, etc. that offer courses with certification and university affiliation. You could either directly visit these websites individually to search and compare courses, or you could visit lore.online to search and compare online learning options from various education providers. You can filter the learning options with the help of Lore's extensive filter list, e.g. as you're looking for courses that offer certification, you can use the certification filter to only view those courses. You can also filter based on how much experience you have, your budget, university affiliation, duration of the course, and user ratings. If you're the type that needs to refer to videos while learning, then Lore also shows relevant YouTube and Vimeo videos alongside the courses. You can also get recommendations based on your career interests, the skills you want to develop and a few other preferences. Hope this helps!
